thread.title: Audi RS3 Sportback: Yet another piece of hot-hatch forbidden fruit - Roadshow
thread.title_full: Audi RS3 Sportback: Yet another piece of hot-hatch forbidden fruit - Roadshow

author: Andrew Krok
title: Audi RS3 Sportback: Yet another piece of hot-hatch forbidden fruit - Roadshow
text:
Audi RS3 Sportback: Yet another piece of hot-hatch forbidden fruit 
Audi originally announced the RS3 sedan at the Paris Motor Show in 2016. Photo by: Audi 
Now, less than a year later, Europe will receive a hatchback variant called the RS3 Sportback. Photo by: Audi 
Don't count on this one coming to the US, though. Buyers here don't like hatchbacks. Photo by: Audi 
It packs the same 400-horsepower, 2.5-liter I5 as the RS3 sedan. Photo by: Audi 
Thanks to its all-wheel drive, the RS3 Sportback will shimmy itself to 62 mph in just 4.1 seconds. Photo by: Audi 
The top speed is set at 155 mph, unless you ask for a higher top speed, in which case it'll be 174 mph. Photo by: Audi 
Carbon ceramic brakes are optional. Photo by: Audi 
It's 1.0 inch lower and 0.8 inches wider than the standard Audi A3 Sportback. Photo by: Audi 
Order books for the RS3 Sportback open in April. Photo by: Audi 
It will run you €54,600 ($58,064, directly converted), which is actually €1,300 ($1,382) less than the sedan. Photo by: Audi
